question_text: Which factor differentiates M.2 NVMe drives from traditional SATA SSDs in terms of data handling?
answer_options: SATA SSDs support more simultaneous I/O queues
M.2 NVMe drives use rotational latency reduction
NVMe allows multiple queues with thousands of commands
M.2 NVMe drives have mechanical read/write heads
correct_answer: NVMe allows multiple queues with thousands of commands
explanation: NVMe supports up to 64K queues with 64K commands per queue, making it far superior to SATA's single-queue limitations.
